column4: you have to get your friend to tell you his public IP address
set up her router to port foward your request to her IP
what's the chances it'll already be set up as needed?
suppose it was, what would i type
Unless she knows what she's doing and has done it before....
connection timed out
then port forwarding on her router hasn't been set up
on a scale of 1-10 how hard is it to do
pretty easy, but she's got to do it from her end. Look up the model of her router and google "Port Forwarding <routername>"
ok thanks :)
Good luck!
she's wip[ed Windows and ubuntu wont log in - so she's created a big metal box :D
You'll most likely have to be able to physically access the machine. SSH won't do the trick if it's a brick
Ctrl+alt+F1 works
and she lives in Finland - that's a long journey from England :D
do you know if she ever install the ssh package? Ubuntu by default does not support incoming SSH connections
i got her to istal openssh-server
so find the model of her router, and figure out how to forward port 22 on it over the TCP protocol
will do, but tomorrow. it's time i was in bed lol
hah, good luckl
